intro: Deckenia nobilis, commonly known as the noble deckenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its natural environment.
